Package ohos.security.keystore

Class KeyStoreKeySpec

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.security.keystore.KeyStoreKeySpec
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    KeySpec

    public class KeyStoreKeySpec
extends Object
implements KeySpec
    Stores key specifications.

    A key specification contains the key alias, source, purposes, length, validity period, and block cipher mode.

    Since:
    1
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Security.KeyStoreProvider

    • Method Detail

      • getSecKeyAlias

        public String getSecKeyAlias​()
        Obtains the alias of a key.

        This alias can be used to retrieve the key entry in the KeyStore.

        Returns:
        Returns the key alias.
        Since:
        1

      • getSecKeySource

        public int getSecKeySource​()
        Obtains the source of a key.

        The source of a key can be generated by the KeyStore, imported to the KeyStore from outside, or unknown.

        Returns:
        Returns the source of the key, which can be KeyStoreConstants#SEC_KEY_SOURCE_GENERATED, KeyStoreConstants#SEC_KEY_SOURCE_IMPORTED, or unknown.
        Since:
        1

      • getSecKeyUsagePurposes

        public int getSecKeyUsagePurposes​()
        Obtains the purposes for using a key.

        Examples include encryption, decryption, signing, and signature verification.

        Returns:
        Returns the purposes for using the key, which can be KeyStoreConstants#PURPOSE_CAN_ENCRYPT, KeyStoreConstants#PURPOSE_CAN_DECRYPT, KeyStoreConstants#PURPOSE_CAN_SIGN, or KeyStoreConstants#PURPOSE_CAN_VERIFY.
        Since:
        1

      • getSecKeySizeInBits

        public int getSecKeySizeInBits​()
        Obtains the key length.
        Returns:
        Returns the key length in bits; returns the default value (for example, 128 bits for an AES key) if the length is not specified when the key is generated.
        Since:
        1

      • getKeyCryptoAttr

        public String[] getKeyCryptoAttr​(int type)
        Obtains the cryptographic attribute set of a key, depending on the input parameter.
        Parameters:
        type - Indicates the cryptographic attribute of the key, which can be KeyStoreConstants#CRYPTO_PARAMETER_DIGEST, KeyStoreConstants#CRYPTO_PARAMETER_ENCRYPT_PADDING, KeyStoreConstants#CRYPTO_PARAMETER_BLOCK_MODE, or KeyStoreConstants#CRYPTO_PARAMETER_SIGNATURE_PADDING.
        Returns:
        Returns the cryptographic attributes of the key and their values.
        Since:
        1

      • getSecKeyAuthDuration

        public int getSecKeyAuthDuration​()
        Obtains the validity period of user authentication for a key.

        If a key requires user authentication (see KeyStoreConstants#FLAG_KEY_ACCESSIBLE_NEEDED_USER_AUTH), this method can be used to obtain the validity period of user authentication.

        Returns:
        Returns the validity period (in seconds) of user authentication; returns -1 if user authentication is required every time the key is used.
        Since:
        1

      • isKeyAccessible

        public boolean isKeyAccessible​(int flag)
        Checks the accessibility of a key based on the input parameter.
        Parameters:
        flag - Indicates the purposes for using the key, which can be KeyStoreConstants#FLAG_KEY_ACCESSIBLE_NEEDED_USER_AUTH, KeyStoreConstants#FLAG_KEY_ACCESSIBLE_NEED_DEVICE_UNLOCK, or KeyStoreConstants#FLAG_KEY_ACCESSIBLE_NEED_RANDOMIZED_ENCRYPTION.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the key is accessible; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1
